definition: to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: The formation of Tang Attire has various historical reasons.
sentences.chinese: 唐装的形成有各种历史原因。

sentences.english: I want buy a pure silk traditional Chinese garment.
sentences.chinese: 我想要买一件纯丝绸的唐装。

sentences.english: I'm very fond of clothes of your Chinese style, and I'd like to buy a TangZhuang overcoat.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢你们中国式的衣服，我想要买一件唐装外套。

sentences.english: I would like a Tang-style suit.
The Tang costume stands for Chinese history and fashion culture.
sentences.chinese: 唐装代表着中国的历史和服装文化。

sentences.english: I am going to buy a Chinese costume for myself.
sentences.chinese: 我正打算给自己买一件唐装呢。

sentences.english: Tang clothes chinese people are proud of Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐装中国人自豪的唐朝。

sentences.english: A:I'm very fond of clothes of your Chinese style, and I’d like to buy a TangZhuang overcoat.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢你们中国式的衣服，我想要买一件唐装外套。
秋天是唐装忙碌紧张的季节。

sentences.english: Today the Tang costume can be designed as formal or casual clothes.
sentences.chinese: 现在唐装被设计成有正式款的也有休闲款的。

definition: long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
Chinese skullcap resembling the skin of half a watermelon
